meanings.definition: Restore to a whole; make complete again.
meanings.sent1: She worked hard to redintegrate the broken pieces of the vase.
meanings.sent2: After the storm, the community came together to redintegrate their damaged homes.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to redintegrate the torn paper, but ended up with a paper butterfly instead.
meanings.sent4: His love for her was so strong that it seemed to redintegrate his shattered heart.
meanings.sent5: The puzzle pieces fit perfectly together, as if eager to redintegrate into a complete picture.

meanings.sent1: The company decided to redintegrate their partnership with the local charity.
meanings.sent2: Every spring, the gardeners redintegrate the soil to ensure healthy plant growth.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to redintegrate the recipe after accidentally adding too much salt.
meanings.sent4: The artist's new painting seemed to redintegrate the beauty of the old town.
meanings.sent5: The rain helped redintegrate the freshness of the air, washing away the pollution.
